{"id":1296802430,"question_id":3475,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"7 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1719069644,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"105 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1296802430/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Operations to Make Binary Array Elements Equal to One I","memory":"138.5 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n\n    int minOperations(vector<int>& nums) {\n        int ans = 0; \n        int sz = nums.size();\n        if(sz <3)\n            return -1;\n        \n        for(int i=0; i<sz; i++) {\n            if(i == nums.size()-3) {\n                if(nums[i] + nums[i+1] + nums[i+2]==0) {\n                    ans++;\n                }else if(nums[i] + nums[i+1] + nums[i+2]<3) {\n                    ans = -1;\n                }\n                break;\n            }\n        \n            if(nums[i] == 0) {\n                nums[i] = 1;\n                nums[i+1] = 1-nums[i+1];\n                nums[i+2] = 1-nums[i+2];\n                ans++;               \n            }            \n        }\n        return ans;     \n    }\n    \n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-operations-to-make-binary-array-elements-equal-to-one-i","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
